qas.question: In what decade did Philips produce a "professional" LD model for computer?
In what year were LD jukeboxes created?
Which musical artists were featured on LD Jukeboxes in 1985?

answers.text: Michael Jackson, Duran Duran, and Cyndi Lauper

context: In the <a0_0>early 1980s<a0_0/>, Philips produced a LaserDisc player model adapted for a computer interface, dubbed "professional". In <a1_0>1985<a1_0/>, <a2_0>Jasmine Multimedia<a2_0/> created LaserDisc Juke Boxes featuring music videos from <a3_0>Michael Jackson, Duran Duran, and Cyndi Lauper<a3_0/>. When connected to a PC this combination could be used to display images or information for educational or archival purposes, for example thousands of scanned medieval manuscripts. This strange device could be considered a very early equivalent of a CD-ROM.
